subdialogue_text: Well, this is unexpected. I don't often have visitors.
What do you want?
This is my study that you've happened upon.
If you haven't any business, I've reading to get back to.
Yes, I see.
On your way, then.
This is my study, and I've plenty of reading to do.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Nothing" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Oh, enough of you, already.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Nothing" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Do you have business with me?

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: How intriguing.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: You'd better not. Sorcery is not for everyone.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: And should never be forced.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: You have your own methods. Sorcery need not be one of them.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: Don't let it bother you.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: Be on your way, then.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: You're Unkindled. Shouldn't you get back to your duty?

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: Oh, I thought you'd already given up.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: Well, nothing has changed. You're not inclined for sorcery.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: It is either a natural fit, or no fit at all.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: Be on your way, then.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" with 9 Intelligence or less
subdialogue_text: You're Unkindled. Shouldn't you get back to your duty?

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: Well, well... There's something different about you, isn't there?

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: Very well.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: Indeed, I am a sorcerer. With plenty to share.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: However...

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: What champion demands service without recompense?

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: Clearly, you are not that sort of man.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: Clearly, you are not that sort of woman.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: So, you will make me a promise.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: That in exchange for my teaching, you will bring me knowledge.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: In the form of scrolls detailing sorcery's secrets.

behavior: #0Choose "Ask to learn sorceries" after returned with 10 Intelligence or more
subdialogue_text: Well? Can you assure me of this?

subdialogue_text: I can respect an honest woman.

But I've already put in more than

subdialogue_text: Be on your way, then.

behavior: #0Choose "Make no promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: Though you're welcome back if you change your mind.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Make no promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: Have you changed your mind?

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Make no promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: If I am to teach you, you are to fetch me knowledge.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Make no promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: In the form of scrolls detailing the secrets of sorcery.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Make no promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: Can you make this promise?

behavior: #0Choose "Make a promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: Very well.

behavior: #0Choose "Make a promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: You are no fool. I take it you understand the weight of a promise.

behavior: #0Choose "Make a promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: I am Orbeck of Vinheim.

behavior: #0Choose "Make a promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: Unkindled one, I shall teach you sorceries.

behavior: #0Choose "Make a promise" to either the 3rd or 4th query
subdialogue_text: We will learn together, it shall be like our very own school.
What's the meaning of this?
Stop while you're still ahead.
Is that how it is?
Then we are through and done.
Enjoy your long sleep!
Gods, this business never did agree with me...
I've lost...my touch...
Oh, you're back, then.
Again, I'm Orbeck of Vinheim, here to teach you sorceries.

Let us begin with the basics.
The ideal sorcerer bears the twin faces of the dragon...
...Oh, you could at least act as if you're paying attention!
(laugh)
Back again, I see.
I suppose this means that you're after sorceries?
Back again, I see.
Perfect timing, too. I'm in need of a diversion.
Oh, what is it? Forgot something?
That would be quite like you.
I don't mean to seem overbearing, but have you forgotten?
In exchange for my sorceries, you are to bring me knowledge.
In the form of scrolls detailing the secrets of sorcery.
I hope you're not one to break a promise.
Have you forgotten our agreement?
I am starved. For sorceries.
Come now, I've been charitable long enough.
Again, I'm Orbeck of Vinheim, here to teach you sorceries.

Let us begin with the basics.
The ideal sorcerer bears the twin faces of the dragon...
...Oh, you could at least act as if you're paying attention!
(laugh)

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after giving him one scroll & purchasing 3 spells
subdialogue_text: Oh, I have something for you.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after giving him one scroll & purchasing 3 spells
subdialogue_text: You're a fine sorcerer now, no mistake.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after giving him one scroll & purchasing 3 spells
subdialogue_text: You should have something to prove it.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after giving him one scroll & purchasing 3 spells
subdialogue_text: Go on. If I'm giving something away, you'd better well take it.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after giving him one scroll & purchasing 3 spells

subdialogue_text: How do you like gimmicks, friend?

This is a sign, a cipher employed by sorcerers
who use quietude to their advantage.

With this, you can be sure to tell friend
from foe from your very first encounter.
It's a very old practice at this point...
...but one that you deserve to know.
In Vinheim, I was an assassin.
A sorcerer only in name, a killer for hire.

What a fool I was,
thinking one day I would learn real sorceries.
When I became Undead, I was exiled from the school.
But here I am, now, exploring the depths of sorcery.
All thanks to you, I might add.
You are no ordinary man.
You are no ordinary woman.
All these sorceries, and you've mastered every one.
If this were the Dragon School, you'd be...
..well, overtly despised, and banished from the place.
(laugh)
Well, I suppose it's time I packed my bags.
I would hate to see our agreement end sourly.
Better left tucked away, as a pleasant memory.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after Yuria arrived in Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: It is folly to claim lives recklessly, friend. Do not be tempted.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after Yuria arrived in Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: No matter the victim's stature, every killing has a consequence.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after Yuria arrived in Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: Even as I bloodied my hands, I never realised this simple truth.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after Yuria arrived in Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: Hmph. There I was, the very definition of a fool...
Oh, my... This is stupendous.

Then the Undead Legion of Farron
possesses sorceries quite unknown.
Thank you, for upholding your end of the bargain.

I doubt I ever would
have made this discovery alone.

Now, let us unravel the thing,
so you may put these new sorceries to use.
Oh, my! You've made quite the discovery!
This is a scroll of the prodigious Big Hat Logan.
A masterful sorcerer, long missed in Vinheim.
And now, we have his scroll, right here in my very hands.
Unfathomable.

This is a crystal sorcery, created by the pale dragon,
thought only to exist in legend...
I am ever grateful to you. This is truly sublime.
I am afraid this is a debt I cannot repay, only...
I will be sure to unravel it for you. Just a moment.
Oh, my... This is very unusual.
It's from Oolacile, an ancient land of golden sorceries.

Not even the Dragon School
possesses such a long-lost scroll.

What would the xanthous scholars say,
with their ridiculous headwear.
They would simply slaver over this find.
(laugh)
Come again.
Don't forget what you promised.
Promise to stay safe.
Promise to stay safe.
It's been nice running our own little school.
What is this about?
Have you lost your wits?
Seems it's too late.
Then, there's only one thing to do.
With regret, I will end this here and now!
Gods, what have I done...
But, why...
Is that all that I'm worth?
